page.title: 02BOUNDARY OAK SCHOOL,FAREHAM
page.content: Boundary Oak School is a private,boys'boarding school in N.Fareham.It was originally a large medieval house,which has been added to over the centuries.The school has a wide curriculum and varied sporting activities including athletics,gymnastics and sailing.There are also many clubs which the pupils attend after school finishes at 3p.m.,these include computer,craft and music clubs.The uniform consists of a burgundy blazer,a white or grey shirt and grey shorts.The age range is from 9 to 18. The school is set in it's own grounds with an imposing gatehouse entrance and surrounding woodlands. The building which houses the school is known as Roche Court.Pupils come from a wide area for private education to this school.
